avdta.network.cost

Class TravelCost

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.cost.TravelCost
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DNLGenCost, DNLTime, FFTime, GenCost, TTCost

    public abstract class TravelCost
extends java.lang.Object
    A TravelCost is an abstract way to calculate per link travel cost, used for finding shortest paths in Network. It defines the method cost(avdta.network.link.Link, double, int), which returns the cost for traveling a link at the specified time with the specified value of time. There is no need to create new instances for each Network. Some commonly used TravelCost subclasses are defined within the TravelCost class.

      • cost

        public abstract double cost(Link l,
                            double vot,
                            int time)
        Calculates the cost of traveling on Link l starting at the specified time, with the specified value of time.
        Parameters:
        l - the Link
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        time - the time of arrival (s)
        Returns:
        depends on subclass
